argument.description: The number to convert to an interval.
The unit to convert to. It must be one of the following values: DAY, HOUR, MINUTE, or SECOND.

returnType: The NUMTODSINTERVAL function returns an INTERVAL DAY TO SECOND value.
description: The Oracle/PLSQL NUMTODSINTERVAL function converts a number to an INTERVAL DAY TO SECOND literal.
sample:
NUMTODSINTERVAL(150, 'DAY')
Result: '+000000150'

NUMTODSINTERVAL(1500, 'HOUR')
Result: '+000000062'

NUMTODSINTERVAL(15000, 'MINUTE')
Result: '+000000010'

NUMTODSINTERVAL(150000, 'SECOND')
Result: '+000000001'
